author: Jess Bravin
title: Supreme Court Justices Question Minnesota’s Ban on Political Buttons at Polling Stations
text:
WASHINGTON—Minnesota’s ban on wearing political buttons and insignia within its polling stations, which the state says is designed to protect the “solemnity” and “dignity” of voting from political clamor, appeared Wednesday uncertain to survive the Supreme Court’s constitutional scrutiny.
Many states restrict electioneering around polling stations, a practice previously upheld by the court to protect voters from intimidation and preserve decorum at a civic exercise. But Minnesota goes further than most, prohibiting not only...
